{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the patient's history and physical examination findings, the most likely diagnosis is erythema nodosum. Erythema nodosum is characterized by tender, erythematous nodules on the anterior surface of the lower legs. It is often associated with a preceding infection, such as streptococcal pharyngitis, which the patient had 1 week ago. The next best diagnostic step in this patient would be a throat culture to confirm the previous streptococcal infection.", "answer_choice": "A"}
